title: Social Role-Based Learning Technology Design: Application in Science Education

context.prior_knowledge: Expert-level knowledge and experience in solving complex problems
context.additional_context: Learners possess intermediate expertise in science as general citizens and are accustomed to non-real-time online learning environments using digital devices.

learning_goals: Learners can analyze actual learner/instructor roles when designing science education technology by applying Positioning Theory
Learners can explain methods for mapping the actual roles of stakeholders (teachers, learners, administrators) when designing science content in an LMS environment
Learners can predict potential issues and propose alternatives when applying science learning technologies based on established social role models
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
